Articles.Content:
![rubix%20cube.jpg](http://www.cnusd.k12.ca.us/cms/lib/CA01001152/Centricity/Domain/0/rubix%20cube.jpg)

Who here on the Forum is a Cuber?

I've got a modded 3x3x3 (It's covered in LEGO bricks of the face color, because why not? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)), a 4x4x4, and a 5x5x5.

I can solve them all of course. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

(I might need to look up an algorithm for a particularly tricky parity now and again on the 4x4x4 and 5x5x5)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-12T02:33:10Z" title="07/12/2015 02:33  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 12, 2015</time> by Starwhip**

First!

I solve 1x1x1, 2x2x2, 2x2x3, 3x3x3, 4x4x4, and 5x5x5. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I also have a Sphere cube. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-12T19:04:48Z" title="07/12/2015 07:04  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 12, 2015</time> by Endersmens**
I can do a 3x3x3! Paradoxically, the 2x2x2s are the hardest for me to solve.

> 
> I can do a 3x3x3! Paradoxically, the 2x2x2s are the hardest for me to solve.

Same for me.

I think I maybe solved a 2x2x2 ***once***. :|
Iv' a never had a cube long enough to solve it... I'll need to go get one...
I try so, so hard to solve these, but I can never do it. I brain can't even! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

I used to be able to solve a standard 3x3x3 back when they were new, but I had to buy a book to do it. Before I bought the book, I could solve the top face and 2 rows down the sides, but the bottom face would stymie me.

Now my kids have them, and they couldn't be bothered. At least now I only had to look on the Web to solve it.

I never messed with the other sizes, and the sphere is just a rounded cube.

> 
> and the sphere is just a rounded cube.

Not entirely true. The one I have wasn't "sanded and rounded" from a cube. It has a similar core as a cube. But the pieces were made to make it a sphere, not a cube. It's the same concept though, 6 faces with 9 colored pieces on each side. I'll put up a picture later. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Oh, I also had one of these:

![speedcubing.jpg](http://www.random-good-stuff.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/speedcubing.jpg)

I never understood these. I had a friend who had a book that supposedly showed you exactly how to solve it. I couldn't figure out why that was supposed to make it more fun.

I have similar problems with Prima Strategy Guides.
I have a cube, but it was never solved.
There are such things as Boy Scout themed rubix cubes, I have one, but it's in my troops trailer. (I'm le quartermaster)
